document_title: Cirrhosis: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment of the disease
subsection_content:
Fatigue and lack of energy are signs of cirrhosis
Symptoms of cirrhosis depend on the stage of the disease. Doctor Thanh said that in the early stages, patients may not have any symptoms or if they do, they are very vague and easily confused with symptoms of other diseases. Early signs of cirrhosis include:
The body is tired and lacks energy; Loss of appetite, loss of appetite; Nausea; Mild fever; Unintentional weight loss
As the disease progresses, more serious cirrhosis symptoms appear, including:
Yellow skin, yellow eyes; Itchy skin, dark skin; Easy bruising and bleeding; The palm of the hand turns red (lipstick hands); Many red vasodilated spots appear on the skin, also called vascular star spots; Swelling (edema) in the legs, feet, and ankles; Ascites is also known as ascites (accumulation of fluid in the abdominal cavity); Dark urine; Stools may be pale; Confusion, memory loss, personality changes; Bloody stools, or bloody vomiting; Reduced sexual desire, manifested by early menopause (in women) or mammary gland development (in men), testicular atrophy.
